Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain
Comments_List: The ability to respond to some daily elements and make compositions.
attention to composition, basic background in color theory, and collaborative work in visual art
I now know most forms of studio arts and how they can be applied and made and created with limitless possibilities, and I have the abilities to appreciate art more.
Appreciation level and analytical ability were improved by the course. The class also practiced our hand working ability.
I developed the skill to analyze artworks from multiple perspectives and to apprehend the cultural and aesthetic importance of visual presentations.

I learned to consider and analyze the color and other elements in an artwork and by looking through the Yale's art gallery with class I met various classic and elegant art works. I also learned to expand the way ti explore art in a wider context.
The course contains a lot of activities and interesting media. And the process of critique is very thought-provoking.

Strength: diversity of projects and assignments
Weakness: limited time for an ambitious course structure, and consequently little time granted to each of the concentrations

Strength:I had a general knowledge of the forms and genres in art and their possibilities.
Weakeness: Everything tends to be too general. I received nothing too deep in a specific art genre. But understandable due to short time in Summer.

The strength of the course is that it incorporates various forms of visual presentations for the students to explore. The weakness of this course is that each of these forms are not explored on a deep level.

This course provides a good chance for me to visit Yale' art gallery with instructer's leading and teaching. This course also encourge me to work on printing and other forms of art, which I experienced for the firt time. I also got presious advice from my instructor on my previous art projects.

There is no obvious weakness of this course as i experienced. But I would suggest to add more small- groups talks and discussions in oder to encourage more students to speak out their thoughts and make them ready and willing to share their ideas with whole class.
I would if the other student is interested in arts.
Yes, I would. I'd recommend that they take it during the school year, though, so the units are not quite as rushed. Alex and Ana did a great job with the time we had for Summer Session, though.
For anyone who has strong interest and never took art course before, this is definitely one of the best choices! It helps you explores a lot of aspects of art that you couldnt have imagined!

Yes. The class is one of the most important art classes. The course gives us a relaxed environment to create art works. Professor also give us worthy suggestions on art field. Its very helpful for us.
I would because this course has enabled me to explore areas of art that I have not been introduced to before.

Yes, i would definitely recommend this course to other students who are interested in visual thinking and virtuosity. 

Because this course can perfectly match those students' needs to visit elegant and classic artworks in Yale art gallary and to recieve helpful feedback from the instructor on their piece of art.
